column4: this channel is just for support (because it's really busy).  So you can help people here and chat at the same time in #ubuntu-offtopic.  Thanks.
No thanks Im helping people here. Thanks anyways.
that's fine.  But move the non-support talk to #ubuntu-offtopic.  Let's move on...
works fine
The drives Im looking at say 3Gbps. That a bunch of bologna? Will it feel that much faster or just the same as PATA?
try #ubuntu-bugs if no one bites here
thank you
scp, samba if on the same network, hundreds of other ways
Do you know if there are any nice GUI apps like Conduit but actually work? I cant get the network transfers to work with it.
no idea what conduit is.  Is this on the same local network?
Yes. Im just looking for an easy GUI app if possible.
right click on a folder -> properties -> share...
Ah! Ok Ill try that.
unstable as always
Ok I figured that, just wondered if they switched to testing for the LTS releases. Thanks.
http://www.debian.org/doc/ is probably a good place to look, don't remember
http://wiki.debian.org/HowToSetupADebianRepository too
thank you
a release is by definition stable once it's released...
don't use EOL releases...
Why not?
because they are EOL... They aren't supported and don't receive security updates
best choices are latest LTS or latest release
no
